page.title: 11GRIMESTHORPE :East Sheffield
page.content: Grimesthorpe Road follows the line of a Roman road from Buxton to Don- caster, passing through nearby Winco- bank Hill, the site of a{Roman}hill fort, and an earlier Iron-age fort. {Grimesthorpe}takes its name from a later Norse settlement. In Victorian times terraced housing was built in the area to house workers from the local steel wirks.For many years there was a close knit community with its own pubs, primary school and shops. In 1972 a new middle school was opened to replace the old village school and gradually most of the housing was cleared to create a{green- {belt}between houses and factories. A new private estate has been built around the new school and a few small factory units have also been built nearby.
